content.en:
*本課程為英文系高年級(三、四年級)專業文學課程。非此設定範圍但欲選修該課程的同學(含外系及校外人士)，需參與開學第一堂課，並在課後與授課老師面談。若符合修課標準，會視情況核發選課密碼卡。
Since his first appearance in Geoffrey of Monmouth’s The History of Kings of Britain, King Arthur (as a literary figure) has gained high, unending popularity in the corpus of secular literature throughout the Middle Ages. In our survey we will read a cluster of medieval Arthurian texts that helps establish this very literary canon. As Arthurian literature (sometimes known as ‘Arthuriana’) remains a trans-European phenomenon, we will incorporate many texts outside of the Anglophone world in translation, and the chosen texts are roughly grouped under three linguistic headings: the Latin tradition (Geoffrey of Monmouth), the French tradition (Beroul and Chrétien de Troyes), and the English tradition (Marie de France, Chaucer, and Malory). By reading these texts, students are expected to not only gain a more diverse, comprehensive understanding of the changing nature of Arthurian legends, but also develop a critical sense of individual texts pertaining to their historical backgrounds and contexts. In addition, in order to frame Arthurian literature according to our modern concerns, we will spend a certain amount of time investigating themes pertaining to cultural colonialism, gender, emotion studies, and reception studies. The course will be conducted entirely in English and is open for all majors. Former knowledge of British Literature 1 is preferred.
